references.reason: This paper is foundational for probabilistic logic, which is a key concept underlying the work on Logical Credal Networks (LCNs).
This book is a seminal work in probabilistic reasoning and is widely referenced in the study of probabilistic graphical models, upon which LCNs build.

references.paper_title: Probabilistic Graphical Models: Principles and Techniques
references.reason: This book provides a comprehensive overview of probabilistic graphical models, which are closely related to LCNs and offer valuable context and background.
This paper introduces Logical Credal Networks (LCNs), which are the central focus of the current research paper.
This paper directly addresses marginal MAP inference in credal networks, a closely related problem to the MAP and Marginal MAP inference tasks studied in LCNs.
